action.action-desc: Mr. Lynch (for himself, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois, and Mr. Quigley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Defense to allow civilian employees of the Department of Defense to delay furloughs until returning from a deployment in support of accounting and recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
POW/MIA Accounting and Recovery Support Act of 2013 .

section.header: Exception to civilian furlough requirements for Department of Defense employees deployed in support of Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command accounting and recovery efforts
section.text: The Secretary of Defense shall require that, with respect to a civilian employee of the Department of Defense who is required to take a furlough that would otherwise occur during the deployment of that employee in support of accounting and recovery efforts by the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command, the employee may take the furlough after returning from the deployment.
